summary: P10.1 Regime Memory State backend testing completed. Core functionality working correctly with 7/8 tests passing. All critical features validated: schema with 3 scopes, current state, historical state, determinism, no-lookahead property, and stability formula calculations.

flaky_endpoints.issue: Timeline endpoint has performance issues with longer date ranges (>30 days), causing timeouts (30-90s) or intermittent 502 errors
flaky_endpoints.impact: Timeline queries for periods longer than ~30 days may fail or timeout
flaky_endpoints.working_scenario: Works correctly for shorter date ranges (≤14 days) and returns proper JSON structure

passed_tests: Schema endpoint returns 3 scopes (macro: 7 values, guard: 4 values, crossAsset: 5 values)
Current regime state endpoint working correctly - returns macro/guard/crossAsset states
Historical state retrieval with asOf parameter working correctly
Determinism test PASSED: same asOf=2026-02-15 produces same inputsHash (1786bb28e1d42b75)
NoLookahead test PASSED: historical daysInState (45d) ≤ current daysInState (57d) for all scopes
Stability formula validation PASSED: 0.5*(57/90) + 0.5*(1-0/10) = 0.817 for all scopes
Multiple calls consistency PASSED: repeated calls return identical inputsHash
Flip counting correctly calculated: flips30d = 0 for stable regime period
Contract validation: all required fields present (scope, current, since, daysInState, flips30d, stability)
Meta fields validation: generatedAt timestamp and inputsHash present for determinism
success_percentage: Backend: 87.5% (7/8 P10.1 tests passed, timeline endpoint performance bottleneck)
action_item_for_main_agent: Optimize timeline endpoint performance for longer date ranges. Consider: 1) Implement pagination for large date ranges, 2) Add caching layer for computed regime states, 3) Optimize database queries in RegimeMemoryService.getTimeline(), 4) Consider async processing for heavy timeline computations spanning >30 days.
